headline: Jamie's Cranberry Spinach Salad
description: This spinach salad is packed with fresh spinach, toasted almonds, and dried cranberries tossed with a sweet and tangy homemade sesame seed dressing.

video.description: Make a healthy spinach salad with a tangy, tasty vinaigrette.
video.name: Jamie‚Äôs Cranberry Spinach Salad

name: Jamie's Cranberry Spinach Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 pound spinach, rinsed and torn into bite-size pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir almonds in butter until lightly toasted. Remove from heat and let cool.
Make dressing: Whisk together oil, sugar, cider vinegar, white wine vinegar, sesame seeds, poppy seeds, minced onion, and paprika in a medium bowl.
Combine spinach with toasted almonds and cranberries in a large serving bowl. Pour dressing over spinach mixture; toss well.

review.reviewBody: TLDR: The dressing is too sweet so add less sugar and definitely add blue cheese crumbles. I was really unsure about the dressing. After a few hours in the fridge, I went to pour it onto the salad and the vinegar smell seemed overpowering, but it doesn‚Äôt taste overly vinegary. I love anything sweet, but the dressing was too sweet even for my taste, which I would‚Äôve thought was impossible. Next time, I‚Äôll cut down on the sugar. I added blue cheese crumbles and I can‚Äôt imagine the salad without them. They add a tang & saltiness that offsets the sweetness of the cranberries and dressing. I‚Äôll definitely make it again.

So I got this recipe from the allrecipes magazine for my bday and we love this salad! It's really yummy. One odd thing I've noticed is the web version and the magazine version are different in a few ways. The dressing calls only for 2 tbsp of the vinegars, sugar and only a 1/4 cup oil. It , also only used 1/3 cup of almonds not the 3/4, I'm making more tonight üôÇthank you for an awesome recipe that we'll use many more times.

I have made this recipe several times, always for large groups. I have been asked for the recipe by multiple people at every event I‚Äôve taken it to! At Thanksgiving, my sister (who is the foodie and best chef of the family) was eating my salad and one she made. She said, ‚ÄúI like your salad better than my salad. I‚Äôm going to need this recipe.‚Äù Haha‚Äî high praise!!
I halved the sugar. That's it. Delish recipe!
I‚Äôve made this salad for years and it never fails to be a hit. Never any leftovers!
Great, but I cut the sugar by 2/3s . There is plenty of sweetness with the cranberries. No need to add those empty calories.

This is hands-down the best version of this salad I‚Äôve ever made. I think the secret is toasting the almonds, which really adds a depth of umami flavor to the whole thing. I made it exactly as written with the exception of the poppy seeds, which I didn‚Äôt have on hand. Others have said that they drastically cut back on the sugar. I think the sweetness is needed, but the quantity of dressing was quite a bit more than I felt was needed for the amounts of the other ingredients. I made the dressing according to the recipe, dressed the salad with about 1/3 of the dressing and refrigerated the rest. It‚Äôs a matter of personal taste, of course, but I thought it was perfect that way. I‚Äôve made the salad two more times using the leftover dressing. Thank you for a delicious recipe!

This is good just as it is written. I toasted the almonds and sesame seeds together, used red wine vinegar instead of white wine vinegar because that‚Äôs what I had. My hubby, who is not a salad lover, liked it a lot.
Delicious! Thank you
Cut the sugar if you want to--I used 1/4 cup and the recipe didnt suffer. Also used Olive Oil. This is delish!!! We add boiled egg slices sometimes and mushrooms sometimes. Enjoy!!

Made this for Xmas Day dinner and it was a hit. The only change I made was to add oranges - cut into segments and those segments halved. I also added a very small amount of sliced red onion because I felt it needed a little more color and more ingredients. The dressing is very good.
This was a hit with my guests! Highly recommend. Will make this again and again this winter.
Came out perfect and delicious, my daughter loved the smell of the roasting of almonds while making this dish. Two thumbs up!!!
I love this salad exactly as described. I also love it with half the sugar, feta, carrots, roasted chickpeas‚Ä¶.just about any addition is delicious.
Holy heck this dressing is AMAZING!
I've made this a dozen times and it's perfect as written. Lots of areas to adapt the recipe if you like though. Always gets rave reviews from my guests.
Whoever Jamie is, thank her. I‚Äôve been making her Cranberry Spinach Salad for years and everyone always loves it!

One of my favourite salad recipes, and I have lots. However, I alter it a bit by adding a cubed cooked beet and 1 cubed apple. I fry 1 cup of crushed walnuts until lightly brown then continue to fry briefly with 4 TBSP of maple syrup (easier than caramelizing almonds and kids love them), then let cool and break them up. The best part is adding chunks of goat cheese. This combination is great with this salad dressing and other ingredients. You can decrease the amount of sugar in this dressing a tad. It‚Äôs quite sweet, and there‚Äôs enough sweetness with the apples, walnuts and cranberries. If not, it still tastes fantastic.
Used half the sugar, the rest remained the same. Delish!
This salad was delicious! I also added some spring mix and mandarin oranges (each wedge halved). I took home an empty bowl!
Waaaaaayyyyy too sweet. I wish I'd thought about the 1/2 cup sugar before putting it in. No thank you
The only thing I changed in this recipe is cutting it in half. Doing that made enough for my family of 4 (2 adult children.
Delicious and very easy to make.

this is a great recipe and I like how you can adjust the number of servings to get the right measurements. I had dry roasted some raw almonds recently so I used those; less calories than using the butter, I added 2 T of olive oil mayonnaise to make it creamy
I made this for my grown daughters birthday and it took a bland dinner from blah to YAY! It was a hit. My grown kids fought over taking the leftovers home. Excellent salad!

DELICIOUS! I made this for Thanksgiving and everyone raved about it and went back for seconds. Every family happily took home leftovers too! I substituted grape seed oil at an equal ratio to the veggie oil. I also used Craisins as suggested by others and used packaged honey roasted almonds to save time. This is going in my personal recipe book!

We loved this. The salad mixture can be changed up to suit your preferences. I used toasted pine nuts, goat cheese, and a spring mixture with cranberries. The dressing goes a long way. We used it for three salads. A big hit with all.

It would have been better with a little bit less sugar. If you like salads you will love the book ripsy's recipes. There are tons of healthy salads, appteizers and dessert recipes. Definitely worth checking out.

A Hit! I was searching Allrecipes looking for a different dressing for my sweet slaw to go with Texas BBQ. I substituted red cabbage for the spinach (can‚Äôt get hubby to get spinach) Added carrots, and diced apple. I also used half pumpkin seeds and half almond slivers. Colorful, crunchy and sweet, hubby couldn‚Äôt get enough. Thanks Jamie!
A favorite recipe my entire family enjoys! I usually make this for Thanksgiving and/or Christmas.
Fantastic recipe. I added real bacon and feta to it: it really made a solid, savory salad--yet very well balanced. Served with a full turkey dinner and pinot noir. Highly recommended.

This was really good and fairly simple to make. I did half spinach and kale. I also added chopped red onions and some bacon crumbles. The kale holds up nicely with the spinach & dressing the next day.
Very good receipe. My family loved it. I used a bit less sugar in the dressing and added a dash of lemon juice.
Prepared the recipe as written. Delicious salad with a great crunch! Definitely will make again!
Oddly enough, I had all the ingredients and was able to make it exactly as written. It's very good. I had leftover dressing, but I used it later on a fruit salad and it was great there too!
Delicious!
Great salad and easy! Used agave sweetener instead of sugar, and had some Orange Blossom vinegar on hand and used that for the vinegar. Will definitely make this again!
Best Spinach Salad Ever!!!

To make it slightly healthier: 1) use a sprinkle of sugar instead of the amount called for - I sometimes sub with coconut sugar, brown sugar... have omitted it entirely before and it's still good, just not as. 2) you can toast your almonds without the butter, or with just a thin coating. It's not as rich, but still deliciously toasty. And yes, freshly toasted almonds is totally worth it. I've literally been making this salad since I found it in 2013, and have made it for many a party and potluck. It's true that it's always very well-received. I never have the poppy seeds though, and started eyeballing all the ingredients rather haphazardly about six years ago. Amazing as written, and still good if you believe in making salads as unfussy as possible like me!
This salad was great. Very easy to do (assuming you don't burn the sesame seeds the first time around), and the outcome is sophisticated and very tasty. I followed the recipe to a T. Thank you!

Argh.. I really dislike to seeing reviews when people change up the recipe before they actually follow up on it the first time. Alas! Well I actually did it this time and only because my husband wanted a salad but didn‚Äôt want my usual salad dressing I make...
Sooooooooo good!
This salad is so good! I get so many compliments on the dressing, which has a wonderfully unique flavor. We love it!
Made this for Christmas Dinner. Everyone love it!
Easy to put together. Great taste!
Good but way to much dressing. Next time we'll only make half the amount for the salad size we're doing. It is very similar to another recipe on the website.

I have made this salad so many times and I absolutely love it! So does everyone else! It is so easy to make! I love it as the recipe states. I added feta cheese and leftover steak. Made it even better!
Followed recipe only changing out vinegars to white balsamic and red wine vinegar. Now a family favorite.
Loved the basic recipe! I added a diced Cosmic Crisp apple and used . Would definitely recommend this spinach salad recipe finely chopped shallot in the dressing instead of onion.
I only added apples on a whim and it was delicious!!! This recipe is GREAT!

I made the recipe exactly as written and it was delicious! As others have mentioned, it makes a lot of dressing so I just used part of it on the salad and saved the rest to use on other salads. I made the dressing the day before then mixed the salad right before serving and added the dressing. Make sure to whisk the dressing again before adding to the salad. I‚Äôm going to try it next time using goat cheese as others have mentioned. Definitely a keeper!
Very good!! Made a huge salad for 15 people and everyone loved it!!
Delicious! I also tried it with pecans instead of almonds. Both were good.

This was the perfect salad for our Christmas dinner with the extended family. It was easy to transport the individual ingredients, then toss it all together just before serving. Everyone absolutely loved it! I followed the recipe fairly closely, making only 2 changes which other reviews had suggested. I reduced the sugar to 1/3 cup and added some crumbled unripened goat cheese. I will definitely be making this again!
Added some mandarin oranges! Delicious! Will make it again.
Excellent!!

I made this as directed and it was delicious as is! I almost didn‚Äôt make it because of the long ingredients list but I‚Äôm glad I did! I made it yesterday & served it at a Christmas party today and received a lot of compliments on it!
Amazing!! I omitted the sesame seeds and used sunflower seeds, chopped bacon and sliced boiled egg to garnish. Delicious!!
I was glad I read where someone had cut the sugar from 1/2 C to 1 T. I did likewise and it was plenty sweet!
I was looking for a salad that was quick and simple, yet unique. This was VERY well received even by people who are not particularly fans of spinach!

This salad was awesome. I only used 1/4 cup sugar and candied cranberry walnut mix with chopped roasted almonds; I added a little finely chopped red onion on top, bacon and avocado. It was pretty and very tasty - everyone loved it!
Made this for friends dinner and everyone loved it! I added goat cheese and used toasted pine nuts instead of almonds. I didn‚Äôt have white wine vinegar so used champagne vinegar instead.

Wonderful recipe! I didn't have vegetable oil so I used sesame oil, and based on other reviewers I also reduced the sugar to 1/4 cup and replaced poppy seeds with mandarin oranges. But I believe it would have been equally as delicious as written. So quick and easy - thank you!
This is by far the best salad i have ever had !!!! ty for sharing it
A fantastic quick simple salad simple enough to prepare with your children and elegant enough to ace for dinner party.

Love this salad, but especially the dressing. I use Splenda in place of sugar, and often use red wine vinegar or pomegranate vinegar in place of the white, but love it every time. As spinach wilts so easily, we avoid this by applying the dressing to individual portions only. (And feta or crumbled goat cheese makes a great additional as well!)

Made this for a family reunion and they literally licked the bowl clean! I made this recipe as written, expect I didn't add sesame seeds or poppy seeds (didn't have either on hand) and I dry toasted the almond slices in the oven at 350 for 8 minutes. It was delicious!! Will definitely make this again.

Made this for a family reunion and they literally licked the bowl clean! I made this recipe as written, expect I didn't add sesame seeds or poppy seeds (didn't have either on hand) and I dry toasted the almond slices in the oven at 350 for 8 minutes. It was delicious!! Will definitely make this again.
A hit with the family! I left out the poppy seeds because I didn't have any, but that's the only change. My hubby said I need to make this again the next night! :D

Very easy
 Dressing was great, I used more apple cider vinegar than what was called for, but I love vinegar! Had some extra and used on a lettuce salad and it was great. Entire fily said this was a keeper recipe

Served this for the first time at a family get-together and everybody raved about. A few insisted on getting the recipe before they left.

I didn't have poppy seeds but otherwise followed the original recipe.

I can't wait to make this again!

One of my husband's favorite salads (and since he is a carnivore at heart, that is saying something!) I use this recipe for the dressing and then altered some of the ingredients. I use salted pecans, bacon pieces and feta cheese in ours. Tweak it any way you want.

I like dressings in the background. Let the salad ingredients shine. I squeezed half of a lemon into salad bowl. Added thinly sliced onion to the juice (the acid sweetens it). Pour in a little olive oil, small amount of sugar, paprika. Stir to dissolve sugar. That‚Äôs it. 

Toasted almonds in butter, toasted sesame seeds, softened cranberries, avocado, mango, anything goes.
made it again
I always get asked for the recipe. This a great and easy to make.
Only change was paprika...I didn't have any so I used chili powder. It was such a small amount anyway I figured it wouldn't matter. Turned out a bit spicier than the original but was a hit at dinner!

I loved the blend of ingredients, but the dressing was too sweet. Next time I make this, I will cut the sugar by 1/2. The only changes I made was that I added sliced mushrooms to the salad and browned the almonds in the microwave, stirring every 30 seconds until browned.
I reduced sugar and oil a bit after reading reviews and added salt. Good recipe, will make again. Next time I will toast nuts without butter to be more healthy.
LOVE this dressing- I use a lot less sugar and use olive oil rather than vegetable oil. It hardens when refrigerated, but you can microwave it for a few seconds and its still delish!

I am addicted to this spinach salad! It's very healthy and tasty. I don't change a thing in the recipe other than cutting the sugar by half. You can buy the dried cranberries with 50% less sugar than regular, because they do contain alot of sugar. I like to keep the toasted almonds in a small container and use them at the time I eat the salad rather than mixing them into the spinach, because they can get a little soggy otherwise. The dressing is so delicious. I make it about every other week and sometimes two batches per week. Soooo good!

Tossed this salad minus 1/4 cup of the dressing, put it in a spinach wrap (made 10) with sliced chicken breast (slowly roasted in olive oil, garlic, salt, white pepper & onions) and sold it on my food cart. Everyone that tried it said it‚Äôs a ‚Äúmust stay‚Äù on the menu. Thank you!
This was fabulous! I used half the sugar and half the oil and it was very tasty and healthier!
I've had this recipe in my collection for years and it's still a family favorite!
tasty, loved this salad and specially the dressing!

I made this dressing tonight for a 100 person dinner and it received many compliments. The only differences in the dressing were I didn‚Äôt use poppy seeds and i cut the sugar in half. It was still plenty sweet. When I trialled it last week with the planning committee, everyone said the dressing was just right for sweetness, and it was also suggested to leave out the poppy seeds. It is true, they don‚Äôt really add anything to this salad. The salad itself was mixed greens, cranberries, toasted almonds, sunflower seeds, and a few slices of apple (tossed in lemon first).
This is my "go to" spinach salad recipe. Love the dressing!
Love it. We make it all the time.
This is an amazing salad! My new favorite.
I had this at a party over the weekend. It was amazing, tasty light and oh so delicious.
Enjoyed this so much, I made it again the next day. Added more almonds and cranberries the second time at husbands request.
This salad was a huge hit when I served it to friends. Everyone who tasted it, loved it!

I made this for a dinner party, it was a great success! I added mandarin oranges. You could make the dressing as sweet or tart as you want, but I recommend starting with the given recipe. Thank you Jamie!

Love this recipe. Only negative is that once the dressing is on it the leaves start getting soggy. When I make this for my family I will pour dressing on each serving just before eating so that leftovers won't be soggy.
Always excellent
My family did not care for this recipe. Made as written

This salad has the potential of being really good; however, I should have added the dressing more sparingly because it is much too wet with the full receipe amounts. Also, I hesitated about adding so much sugar but did anyway.. Hope it would still taste good without 1/2 cup of sugar and it would be healthier. Makes a pretty salad.
Easy to make with a nice tangy dressing. Yes, I'll make it again.
This is always a hit at my house.

This is a very good salad. I cut back on the sugar by a couple tablespoons and the oil by a couple as well. The flavor was perfect. I found that this salad needed a punch of flavor and added a little feta. With the Feta it became perfect. That combo of sweet salty and the softness of the cheese with the sweetness of the craisins.
